snippet: The West has made greater openness in the Afghan government’s financial dealings a condition of billions of dollars in development assistance and aid money.
abstract: Afghan Mining Min Wahidullah Shahrani discloses about 200 previous mining contracts for first time, attempting to bring transparency to process vulnerable to corruption; Shahrani is enmeshed in political battle over new mining rules seen as vital to attracting foreign investment, but which have been blocked by Afghan cabinet.

byline.original: By GRAHAM BOWLEY and MATTHEW ROSENBERG

lead_paragraph: The West has made greater openness in the Afghan government’s financial dealings a condition of billions of dollars in development assistance and aid money.

headline.seo: Afghan Minister Discloses Details of Mining Contracts
headline.main: Mining Contract Details Disclosed in Afghanistan
headline.print_headline: Mining Contract Details Disclosed in Afghanistan
